boardgame.name: Barbarossa
Barbarossa und die Rätselmeister
Vernissage
バルバロッサ
boardgame.description: Barbarossa, in Italian _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;red beard_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; was, according to its inventor, inspired by the fantasy trilogy Die Schule der R_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;auml;tselmeister (School of the Riddle Masters), in which wizards are devoted to the creation of riddles and riddle solving tournaments. In an interview designer Klaus Teuber stated _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;As you know there are moments when you close a book really sad that it's over. After finishing the last page, you often feel like you've lost a friend -- to be somewhat melodramatic. So I was looking for a way to keep the book alive a little longer. Creating a game seemed the perfect solution. In this game, I was looking for a way to make riddles, to experiment with shapes and to let the players express their own creativity with clay._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game starts with players using modeling clay to make objects that can be guessed by the other players. Players then take turns to move around the board either by rolling a die or spending gems to choose their move. The spaces landed on determine actions. Either the other players receive victory points, or you can ask a letter of an object (What's the fifth letter of that thing?), or you can ask general questions or make a single guess until you get a NO answer. Players also have three curse stones that they can throw down twice in the game and make a guess._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;You make a guess by writing the word down and passing it to the owner, who answers YES or NO. If you guess right, you stick an arrow in the object and score points (5pts if you're first, 3pts for second correct guess). In addition, and this matters, the object owner can either gain points or lose points, depending on the total arrows sticking at the time. So if you make your object too easy, or too hard, you lose points, but if you get it just right, you gain. Plus, at the game end, objects lacking arrows also lose their owners points._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Your objects must each represent a single specific word, which you note down in secret. Trying to think of two or three things that people will guess, but not too easily, is really tricky and makes Barbarossa a fun game. Hopefully the new edition has a better rules set, as players might get puzzled by the variety of actions._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;A later-developed game directly inspired by Barbarossa is Dominic Crapuchettes' Cluzzle._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Re-published by Kosmos / Rio Grande 2001._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Republished by Mayfair Games in 2005, in an edition for a maximum of 4 players in a smaller-sized box._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Shipping is EUR 9 within Europe or $16 worldwide, both surface mail, no insurance, no track+trace. The delivery time is between 5-6 weeks. We have many other interesting and rare games! Email us! We can collect games up to 5 - 10 or 20 kg boxes, so you can save shipping costs! Just email for more information!

Mayfair Games(MFG 4112) A modern classic, Barbarossa is a great game for family and friends! Enter the fantastic world of this casual riddle-solving game. Share laughs with your friends or family as you create and master riddles! First, each player forms objects out of clay. Since the item is a riddle, your clay figure will only show rough contours. So there_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s no need to be an artist when you mold the rough shape of a dinosaur or a bug! _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Is it a living thing?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Is it bigger than me?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; ...these questions might bring you closer to solving the other players_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; riddles. When you solve a riddle, you are rewarded with points. You can also earn points when your riddle gets solved, but only if it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s not too easy and not too hard! You earn bonus points if your riddle is solved in the middle of the game, but you lose points if it is answered early (too easy) or late (too hard)! Earning points is the key to victory, so put your thinking cap on and mold your best riddles in the clay of Barbarossa! Barbarossa was awarded with the prestigious _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Spiel des Jahres_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; game award! But we_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve made it even better. This revised version employs a more portable and intuitive format.

Barbarossa und die Ratselmeister (1988) from ASS Box: Light shelf-wear and a few minor dings and wrinkles. Overall the box is in excellent condition! Contents: One of the pencils is not original and the clay is a bit hard (it IS over 20 years old!) but everything else is here and in excellent condition! The board shows a little wear from use, but that_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s about the only real issue. The clay is easily replaced with some Play-Do or some cheap stuff from the dollar store. This is the classic version and if you_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re a fan of the game, you really should have a copy in your collection! SHIPPING U.S. shipping will be via USPS Priority Shipping and based on a weight of 3 Lbs. International buyers are very welcome, but please contact me for a shipping price quote to avoid any surprises or misunderstandings. I will gladly combine shipping for multiple purchases. The final cost will be based on the total weight, but be aware that large packages that are shipped more than a certain distance accrue a large surcharge, so combining shipping may not save any money.

RESERVED! This game was never played. It is the Kosmos edition with the Spiel des Jahres 1988 seal on the box. I removed the shrink-wrap and taped a corner of the box because it was damaged when it was shipped to me. The board and other components are in mint condition. The modeling clay is still shrink-wrapped, but as with any modeling clay it may be hard. I would think that whenever you actually play this game you would want fresh play-doh. Comes from a smoke-free home.
